intro: Corydalis kingii var. megalantha, commonly known as the giant king's corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in mountainous regions. It produces slender, branching stems and has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a delicate touch of color to its natural environment.
